name: jetls-client
description: A new language server for Julia
author: Shuhei Kadowaki

commands.title: JETLS Client: Restart JETLS Language Server

jetls-client.juliaThreads.description: Number of Julia threads to use (used as --threads= option). Default is 'auto'.

jetls-client.jetlsDirectory.description: Directory path for JETLS project environment (used as --project= option). If not set, uses global Julia environment.

jetls-client.communicationChannel.description: Communication channel for the language server. 'auto' (default) selects the best option based on environment, 'pipe' for local development with stdout isolation, 'socket' for network communication, or 'stdio' for maximum compatibility (but risk of stdout pollution).

jetls-client.socketPort.description: Port number for socket communication (0 = auto-assign). Only used when 'socket' communication channel is used.

jetls-client.jetlsSettings.markdownDescription: JETLS server configuration settings. See [JETLS Configuration](https://github.com/aviatesk/JETLS.jl#configuration) for available options.

debounce.description: Debounce time in seconds before triggering full analysis after a document change.

executable.description: Path to custom formatter executable for document formatting. Optional.

executable_range.description: Path to custom formatter executable for range formatting. Optional.

formatter.markdownDescription: Formatter configuration. Can be a preset name ('Runic' or 'JuliaFormatter') or a custom formatter object. See [Formatting](https://github.com/aviatesk/JETLS.jl#formatting) for details.

enabled.description: Enable or disable all JETLS diagnostics. When set to false, no diagnostic messages will be shown.

patterns.description: Fine-grained control over diagnostics through pattern matching against diagnostic codes or messages.

pattern.description: The pattern to match (e.g., 'lowering/unused-argument' for code matching, or 'Macro name `.*` not found' for message matching).

match_by.description: What to match against: 'code' matches against diagnostic codes (e.g., 'lowering/unused-argument'), 'message' matches against diagnostic message text.

match_type.description: How to interpret the pattern: 'literal' for exact string match, 'regex' for regular expression match.

severity.description: Severity level to apply: 'error'/1 for critical issues, 'warning'/'warn'/2 for potential problems, 'information'/'info'/3 for informational messages, 'hint'/4 for suggestions, 'off'/0 to disable.

executable.description: Path to the TestRunner.jl executable. If not set, uses 'testrunner' from PATH.

scripts.check: npm run check:tsc && npm run check:lint
scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run check && npm run build
